title: REAL-MM-RAG: A Real-World Multi-Modal Retrieval Benchmark
author: Navve Wasserman (IBM Research Israel), Roi Pony (IBM Research Israel), Oshri Naparstek (IBM Research Israel), Adi Raz Goldfarb (IBM Research Israel), Eli Schwartz (IBM Research Israel), Udi Barzelay (IBM Research Israel), Leonid Karlinsky (IBM Research Israel), ...,
relevance_why: The introduction of multi-modal retrieval benchmarks and query rephrasing evaluation may inform methods for improving audio-language models, especially in tasks involving the integration of textual and audio information.
background: The task involves evaluating the ability of models to retrieve relevant documents from multimodal sources (text, tables, and figures) based on natural language queries.
contribution: REAL-MM-RAG introduces a benchmark that emphasizes realistic multi-modal retrieval challenges, enhancing the evaluation of models in complex document environments.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous benchmarks often lacked realistic queries, accurate labeling, or sufficient domain complexity, limiting their effectiveness.
technical_comparison.novelty: This benchmark incorporates multi-level query rephrasing and focuses on realistic, natural user queries across long, specialized documents.

key_innovation: It provides a structured evaluation framework emphasizing rephrasing robustness and diverse document types, which is critical for advancing model development.
real_world_impact: By highlighting model weaknesses in multi-modal retrieval, this work can guide targeted improvements in retrieval-augmented generation applications, enhancing user experience in searching and information retrieval tasks.
limitations: The reliance on large language models and vision-language models for query generation may introduce biases or limit variability in query types.

new_terms.Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG): **Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)** refers to a framework wherein models retrieve information from a corpus before generating a response, combining retrieval and generation tasks.
new_terms.multi-modal retrieval: **Multi-modal retrieval** involves the ability to extract information from various data types, such as text, images, and tables, to accurately respond to queries that may reference any of these formats.
